column4: hey, is there any reason that my router settings page should take a few seconds to load?
slow router?
it is a reasonably new one... wireless n...
of course it is possible, but it seems unlikely.... could it be DNS issues?
what brand?  Routers have built in web servers and if it's a slow processer then it could serve pages slowly
netgear, model is wnr2000
DNS only affects things going through the router.  If you're acessing the router, you should be accessing it directly
anything i can do to speed it up, or rather is there any reason it would be slow that i can fix?
is it all pages or maybe just the status page?
all pages on the router web service load slowly.... takes about three seconds at least to load every page
try hard reseting your router?
i might try that during the week actually, can't hurt.
are you able to access internet pages quickly?
not as fast as i should be able to
you could run speedtest.net to see if your internet connection is up to par
my router says around 13500 kbps downstream
what is your ping time?
on the speed test
ping should be in "ms"
that sounds fine
sure it's not the other way around?
